climbs.name: Wax (aka Nature of the Beast)
climbs.fa: (TR) Chris Miller & Karlis Ogle, February 2000, FL: Todd Gordon et al, 2011

content.description: Unprotected slab moves to an obvious stance gain the first bolt and then steep continuous smearing past the second bolt concludes the crux at the obvious jug; thoughtful friction above leads to anchors. Two stars out of five.
content.location: Starts just left of the obvious dike/crack which splits the formation.

content.description:
Face climb up to a thin dike and the face above with minimal protection. Can be top-roped from anchors on

Jumping Cholla

.
content.location:
Far right side of the wall and just right of

Jumping Cholla

.

content.description: Climbs a crack that passes along several large depressions in the rock to the left end of a ledge and on to the top.
content.location:
Located just left of

Slab Rats

.

content.description: Climb a thin crack to reach a left-slanting crack/flake, follow that for a distance and then head up a thin vertical crack that splits the headwall above.
content.location:
Located between

Wax (aka Nature of the Beast)

and

Jumping Cholla

on the right side of the slab.

content.description: Slabby climbing that links a series of pockets/pods and stays independent for it's entire length.
content.location:
Located between

Desert Five Spot

and

Prickly Pear

.

content.description:
This is the left-most route on the Nature Trail Wall and features well-protected smearing on good rock. Gear belay and walk off, although the easiest descent is to downclimb

Manzanita

, the obvious dike/crack which splits the center of the formation.

Mistakenly listed as "Prison Blues" in the Bartlett Y2K guide.
content.protection: 3 bolts (3/8"), gear to 3 inches for anchors

content.description: This is the obvious dike/crack system in the center of the formation. A very easy route that is useful as a down-climb from neighboring routes.

Low angle slab paddling leads to a somewhat steeper finish that makes it a bit more interesting.

Two bolt anchor on top but not set up for rappelling so use anchors on

Slab Rats

to descend or down-climb the dike in the middle of the formation.
content.location:
Right of

Wax (aka Nature of the Beast)

near the right end of the wall and just left of a thin dike system.

content.description:
This top-rope problem parallels

Nature Walk

to the right as it connects face climbing with several depressions in the rock.
Face climb past a right-arching overlap and then a horizontal crack to reach the obvious zig-zag crack that splits the upper face.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches. Gear anchor. Optional rap from "Slab Rats" climber's right.
content.location:
Left side of the face between

Force of Nature

and

Slab Rats

.
